alert.note: Alert for Cedar (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cedar County through 515 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Durant, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cedar County, including the following locations... Sunbury. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 267 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
